title: Selective Attention and the Cocktail Party Effect
description: A fast breakdown of Selective Attention and the Cocktail Party Effect for builders.

hook.text: At a loud party, someone says your name and you instantly notice.

buildup.text: Your brain constantly monitors background noise for personal relevance.

discovery.text: Colin Cherry called this selective attentionâ€”filtering one stream from many.

twist.text: You miss almost everything on the unattended channel, even language changes.

climax.text: Relevance and emotion hijack the filter, pulling focus without permission.

punchline.text: Your brain is always listening for what matters.

quiz.question: What does the cocktail party effect demonstrate?
options: We can selectively attend to one stream while filtering others
We process all auditory input equally
